metadata.dc:author: del Riego Martín, M
López Rasines, G
Pagola Serrano, M A
Landeras Alvaro, R
Hernández Rodríguez, R
Gutiérrez Baños, J L
Calabia de Diego, A
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVES To determine the sensitivity and specificity of computed tomography and ultrasound in the diagnosis of multilocular cystic nephroma. METHODS Four cases with a pathologically confirmed diagnosis of cystic nephroma were reviewed. RESULTS These four cases had a predominantly cystic mass with thin walls located in the lower pole of the kidney. Both techniques had a sensitivity of 100% for renal masses but a low specificity since they failed to distinguish multilocular cystic nephroma from other cystic lesions. CONCLUSIONS A presumptive diagnosis of multilocular cystic nephroma can be made on the findings of these noninvasive diagnostic imaging techniques. The definitive diagnosis, however, is by anatomopathology.
metadata.dc:title: Estudio mediante tomografía axial computerizada (TAC) y ecografía (US) del nefroma quístico multilocular.
[Computerized axial tomography (CAT) and echography (US) of multilocular cystic nephroma].
